hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1286 a and today's date is May
22nd 2017 and the tottaly episode is how
do you prepare the country for an
economic collapse like this let's get
into the economic collapse financial
news now out in the UK we can see that
well things are not going very well for
the brexit and the negotiation is
actually going to start on June 19th but
we can see already the EU well they're
telling the UK listen if you really want
to leave we're going to need some money
some currency and it's going to be
between 40 to 60 billion euros or it
could even be as high as a hundred
billion so you're going to have to pay
up if you want to leave now we can see
already this is going to be a problem we
can see the negotiations are going to be
chaotic and we can see that the central
bankers they're going to do whatever
they possibly can to keep every single
country who wants to leave the EU in the
EU they don't want any countries leaving
whatsoever now out in Australia we see
the standard and poors they've cut the
ratings of 23 Australian financial
institutions including a MP Ben dingo
the Bank of Queensland citing the risk
of a sharp fall in property prices
mortgage lenders in Australia faced a
surge in bad debts in the event of a
sharp correction in property prices
given household debt is already high
this is coming from SNP
now what they're saying is that in the
event of a sudden property market
correction all financial institutions
operating in Australia are likely to
incur significantly greater credit
losses than present they're saying that
the property market right now well it's
showing signs of cooling down within
Sydney and Melbourne home prices both
are starting to slip and it doesn't look
good and this is according to core logic
and they realize that these financial
institutions well they're going to slip
as well so
they're already getting prepared for
this and we can see that we know that
the housing bubble not just here in the
United States and Canada Australia and
many other places well things are
starting to move the other way in the
other direction and this is not a good
sign now we've been tracking the housing
market here in the United States in
Canada and we can see that things have
been changing where there are many
markets now where it's becoming very
very difficult to move the properties in
Miami we're seeing this as a lot of
condos on the market a lot of
speculators are out there they purchased
the condos and now they're on the market
and they can't move them so we can see
there's a huge problem out in Greece
well the situation there is just getting
worse and worse day by day now the Greek
parliament once again approved more
austerity to unlock the Greek bailout
funds in Brussels but it doesn't look
like it's going to well actually the IMF
the ECB they're still fighting about
this and they want Greece to do more so
the Greek finance ministry inspectors
are about to start seeking out the
owners of all local undeclared
properties what does this mean well
they're going to be looking everywhere
to get their hands on revenue so the
parliament is going to pass regulations
permitting the mass confiscation of
safety deposit box content and financial
assets such as securities to date the
process has been conducted in
handwriting and is therefore
particularly sloped and locating the
assets of taxpayers who have either
concealed incomes or have major debts to
the state the tax authority will be able
to issue online confiscation notices and
immediately get their hands on the
contents of a safety deposit box and
will be able to confiscate the cash the
stones
jewelry and so on and in my personal
opinion I don't think you should keep
anything in the safety deposit box no
matter where you are here in the United
States
well DHS does have the right to go into
safety deposit boxes they did pass a law
going way back
and we can see right now that they will
have the ability to go through your
safety deposit boxes and if you have
gold if you have cash or you have
anything that's valuable in there they
will take it they will go after it now
something very interesting happen with
the student loans there is a bill that
was introduced that will allow the
cancellation of over 1 trillion in
student debt through bankruptcy now this
is very interesting because as of right
now every single student has to pay
their student loan and there are certain
circumstances where you can get out of
it but you just can't declare bankruptcy
and what we're seeing right now is if
this bill is allowed and it lets the
student off the hook the taxpayers well
they're going to flip the bill now the
question is why do they want to do this
because you have to remember they need
to get the funds from someplace and with
all these students right now who have
been going back to college who can't
find jobs who have loan modifications
under the current laws they really can't
do anything they can't use taxpayer
bailouts to collect on these loans and
this is why they're trying to do this
now we can see that this is a huge
amount of money a trillion dollars and
it's not just with the student loan
industry we can see that there's going
to be bit there well they would need to
be bailouts for almost everything today
because when the system crashes once
again you can bet you that they're going
to be going back to Congress saying
listen we need bailouts for everything
and Congress is going to have to decide
do we bail out all these companies again
do we bail out all these banks again and
the bankers they're really not counting
on this this is why they created the
bail in document because they understand
that they can have to get the funds from
someplace and that
going to be from the bank accounts and
that's where they are headed
actually do you know for every $1 of
student debt costs American taxpayers
$38 to collect on that because they hire
debt collectors to go after these
individuals now is it the fault of the
students well they would like to make
you think that but again they've been
pushed into the system where the system
right now does not work so if you're
telling everyone to go back to school to
take out 20 30 40 50 thousand dollars
worth of loans because that's all you
see all over the TV go back to school
get a great job and you come out of
school and I know a lot of people that
have been graduating and they can't find
work actually living with their parents
they have a couple part-time jobs and
they can't find any type of real work so
what we're seeing right now is that all
these individuals and this is why
they've been modifying all the student
loans because they had to stretch it out
over time then they had to base it on
the income of the student because they
realized that there are no jobs out
there they make you think there's plenty
of jobs but the majority of people who
are coming out of college there aren't
any extra that was one College where
students actually sued because the
majority of them couldn't even find jobs
and they were being promised that yes
you'll get a job if you attend this of
you go back to school you will you'll
get work and none of them actually did
now there's a New York bankruptcy judge
who said that we've been seeing a surge
in chapter 11 and chapter 15 filings and
they've exploded like crazy and this is
coming out of New York and the judge is
Shelley Chapman saying that chapter 11
have tripled in the first quarter of
this year while chapter 15s for
companies seeking US aid for
reorganization in a foreign Court have
increased Sevenfold now this is all
coming from the retailers and remember
the retailers that we're reporting on
are just the
stores but we're not talking about the
smaller stores where maybe there's one
store or two stores and that's it
because there's a lot of those and those
are going out of business too they can't
make it either
and we're seeing a surge in all this so
when we talk about 50 bankruptcies we're
only talking about the big chain
retailers we're not even talking about
the small mom-and-pop ones so we can see
right now that the economy and we've
been watching this for quite a while it
is deteriorating and we can see the
decline is accelerating right now and
things are actually not improving
they're actually getting worse and this
is all being done right now on purpose
because the central bankers they
understand that the economy was never
going to be able to work like this Trump
realizes that well listen I tried to
work with what we have right now it is
not going to work out the system needs
to be crashed and the people need to
take control of it now the central
bankers on the other hand they need to
collapse the system and they need to
take control this and we're seeing a lot
more signs of things where they're not
going very well remember we talked about
loan creation well low in creation right
now and this is according to the latest
fed data it is crashed more than it ever
has since the Great Recession actually
we are below the point of where it
happened during the Great Recession so
the situation is actually getting worse
and once we see this downward trend we
know we're heading into something that
is not going to end well at all and what
we look at when we look at commercial
real estate loans over the past year we
see that banks are reporting weaker
demand for the CRE loans in the first
quarter now we've seen this before
going all the way back to 1990 to 1991
92 we saw this happening in 2000 2001
- so that's happening in 2008 2009 2010
and here we are once again and we're at
the same exact spot where we have hit
the top and now it's coming down and
it's following the same exact pattern so
this tells us that we are heading into a
collapse of the system we're already in
a recession every indicator that we've
been looking at shows that we are in a
recession the corporate media that said
they will not tell you you're in a
recession until we're months into the
recession then they go backwards in time
and they say yes we shed the recession
started back in 2016 in the month of
August
now they report on that in December of
2017 this is what they did in the Great
Recession because we were in a recession
leading up to the 2008 crash in October
but they didn't report on it until 2009
and they go backward in time and they
let you know when it all started but
we've been watching it we've been
looking at each indicator industrial
production loan creation the defaults
the auto loan industry and we can see
that it's all falling apart the housing
market that manipulated GDP that
manipulated unemployment it's telling us
it's flashing in our face we are in a
recession we are now heading into a
depression and a collapse so how do you
prepare the country for this can you
just come out and say hey listen
everyone I know Obama said that we're in
a recovery I know the Fed is out there
saying that everything is fine but I'm
going to tell you this right now the
whole system is going to come down it
would freak everyone out right now think
about when you first learned about it
and how you felt we started learning
about all of this you're angry you're
upset you're like wait a minute what's
going on here I've been lied to they
Trump his administration despite the Fed
the deep state they're never going to
come out and tell you that the whole
thing is collapsing Trump has alluded
that
our problems the economy is a mess
everything's in a bubble letting you
know that there are problems behind the
scenes so how you prepare a country well
most of the country since we've been in
this kind of fabulous recovery most of
the people well they're on a lot of
entitlement programs and when we have
this collapse all of this is going to go
away I mean it's just going to cease to
exist
and I'm talking about Medicare Medicaid
I'm talking about food stamps I mean
think about it if the government goes
down and we're in this collapse
situation the currency is devalued they
can't support in any of this Trump
realizes this he understands this this
is why he's cutting entitlements by 1.7
trillion
cutting food stamps by 25 percent trying
to get as many people off of this as
possible because what is going to happen
is that everyone is going to be on their
own the nanny state will no longer exist
the founding fathers of this country
didn't want the government to support
every single person the government was
just to basically administer the country
not to create armies not to create
career politicians not to give them
pensions health benefits to create all
these entitlement programs the
government was only to do the
administration work that's it and the
people would have to work and figure it
all out now people are saying well how
can we do this well you have to remember
the system was taken over the system was
created and put together where the
government would have to take care of
the people the central bank did this to
the entire country by loaning currency
out with its interest attached by
allowing
currency to be continually printed with
no checks and balances which meant that
a lot of people were going to lose work
which meant the value of the dollar was
going to decrease which meant that
things were going to become worse as
time went on and if you go back to 1971
even you go back a little bit further
than that but from 1971 you can really
see it going forward coming out of the
90s going into 2000 if you remember on
the news they said oh the middle-class
you know that's going to disappear
things are not going to work out and we
could see that inflation was hitting
that means the value of the dollar was
continually decreasing and this
continually went on over time here we
are in 2017 were at the end stages of
the economy that's why you see wages
decreasing this is why you see the
interest rates at 0% look at the
beginning when we first came off the
gold standard in 71 interest rates were
what 15 16 17 18 percent
well that was to keep up with the
creation of all the currency coming up
off the gold standard because it was
being devalued wages were increasing
house values were increasing today what
do we say house values increasing
because of bubbles wages decreasing
interest rates as low as possible
no one's making anything on savings
everyone has to be forced into the
market a stock market because that is
the only thing that the central bankers
have full control of manipulating to
make you think that the economy is doing
well so the system was basically
designed not to last for this period of
time and to keep everyone happy they had
to come up with entitlement programs
food stamps because how else could
people support themselves if there's not
enough jobs if the currency is
continually being devalued if housing
prices continually rise we're seeing
inflation because the value of the
dollar continually Falls and as it
continually Falls it just gets worse
worse and worse so how do you prepare
everyone for a collapse well you have to
get them off the system you have to make
it less of a shock now is it going to
work most likely not because we'll
probably hit the collapse way before we
start getting a lot of these people off
the system because I don't blink I don't
think this budget is going to pass I
don't think they'll let it pass but we
can see this is what is being pushed out
there and this is the way you would have
to do it and approach it to have some
type of soft landing but I don't think
we're going to have a soft landing I
think we're going to have a hard landing
and this is why you need to be ready and
prepared for when this hits because when
it hits it's going to be devastating
because the value of the dollar is going
to decrease quite a bit we're going to
see empty food shelves credits going to
freeze up and guess what you're going to
have to fend for yourself you're gonna
have to find food for yourself the
government will not help because we will
lose all trade with other countries
because the way trade works now is that
we give dollars to these countries
because they keep it in reserve to pay
for the oil and they send back products
well the dollar is no longer the reserve
currency they're not sending anything
here this is why Trump continually says
trade is so important right now because
he realizes that the dollar will not
exist the way it is right now we're
going to need trade with other countries
where we're going to have to produce
something to trade with them and we can
see right now that this is something
that is going to be needed so don't
depend on getting the cheap clothing the
cheap products from China don't depend
on getting different food products from
all different like South America and
other places that's all going to come to
an end for a little while just like when
we came on the system back in the 70s
how hard it was to get fuel that's why
we had their green flags the red flags
that's why we had the odd and even

just coming online
it came off the gold standard where
came and fell apart they started

couldn't get oil into the country
there's no oil shortage and you felt
